answers.answer: Hi there!Anti gliadin IgG are not related to diabetes and frequently occur in celiac disease and idiopathic gluten sensitivity. I would suggest meeting up with a gastroenterologist and considering tests to rule out the conditions in your child.Hope this information is helpful.Take care!

question: My daughter has type I diabetes, so we tested our son who seems to be having symptoms of frequent low blood sugars.  His test results are a positive Gliadin IgG.  What does this mean in relation to diabetes type I?
title: Gliadin IgG
